website_summaries.verdict: Best option if you just need the basics in a Fitbit that syncs with your fitness tracker apps.
pros: SmartTrack tracks movement and information for various activities
Syncs to your phone's GPS for real-time tracking and pace information
cons: On the simple side compared to other models, but worth the price for basic tracking

website_summaries.verdict: An affordable Fitbit with a sleek design and lots of functions that will bolster your fitness journey.
pros: This updated version from Fitbit's line of trim trackers includes a heart rate monitor
Enables you to set reminders to guide your activities
Comfortable and stylish on the wrist
cons: Some issues with syncing have been noted
Lacks some of the bells and whistles of larger, costlier models

customer_reviews.title: Low battery life
customer_reviews.text: I love the functions and pretty everything about it except one thing. The battery does not even last a full day. Very disppointed in the battery life
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Has same issues as Fitbit Charge 3
customer_reviews.text: it looks great! but it counts steps while you are sitting and just waving your hand; same as Fitbit Charge 3, I wonder if all fitness trackers have that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bakyt Zhuman

customer_reviews.title: battery is no good
customer_reviews.text: this arrived on tuesday, and i am already charging it (in full) for the 3rd time on saturday. the battery is supposed to last 5 days. further it is supposed to warn you - today it went from 32% to zero, fully off - in an hour. the HR feature doesn't seem to have a track function - that's what i bought it for. also the sleep is only so/so accurate. i was really excited to get this, no mas.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Can't extend display time for clockface
customer_reviews.text: I like the functionality of the Inspire HR, but am disappointed in the display. It displays for 3 or 4 seconds only, Once it goes dark, I tap it and it doesn't come back on immediately - it seems to need a few second of rest. After looking all over the web and finding no information, I called Fitbit tech support to see if I could extend the display time. I was told that you can not extend or adjust the display time on the Inspire. I intend to return my watch; I'll try to find one that is more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is HORRIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: Love the color. The animated icons are very neat. The downside is the battery doesn't last a whole day. How can I have accurate measurements if I need to charge it multiple hours a day?
customer_reviews.author: Liz G.

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I don’t care for the new design but maybe just me. I have boney wrists, and the inspire does not fit well. The light weight and rubber band prevents movement, even with it worn loose. The face of the watch is thick which (also wearing it loose) creates a gap and the face happens to sit on a vein that over time becomes bothersome. Otherwise decent activity tracker
customer_reviews.author: becky

customer_reviews.title: Only 4 stars.
customer_reviews.text: Only 4 stars and it's not because the inspire is off or broken, its actually amazing. Minus one star because the silicone band. Yes, the band. It holds water against your skin and will cause a rash/skin peel. Even if you take it off to dry, you will still sweat and it will still rub. Replaced the band with a 3rd party fabric one for $9.
customer_reviews.author: Boog

customer_reviews.title: Watch Is As Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Received my Fitbit Inspire in the 19th. So far so good. I’m enjoying the features that it has. No issues with the steps the steps going up when I move my arms, only go up when I walk. I feel it is keeping my heart rate correctly, no issues with syncing to my iPhone. Onece I turn on my Bluetooth the watch syncs with no issues. As long as I’m in range of my phone I can see a phone call or text message scroll across the screen of the watch. No problems with the watch band. It has not fell apart and doesn’t came unhooked from the watch. I’m enjoying my watch.
customer_reviews.author: dabannis

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this new Fitbit. Their's a few quirks like that it tracks steps while you are driving or laying in bed texting. But! It is way better than the charge 3 and the alta. The alta and the charge would count hand movements like crazy. It would count 1000-2000 steps while driving or just laying in bed but the inspire hr only counts like 20-40 steps instead of 1000 or so. I also kinda wish that the Fitbit would have come with better instructions because I accidentally turned on the timer and I had no idea how to make it stop. But eventually I figured it out on my own.
customer_reviews.author: Kalli

customer_reviews.title: Very bright at night - touch screen very sensitive
customer_reviews.text: It is a good price $99 and the Sleep tracking feature is great to show deep sleep and REM Sleep. Tracker is a bit thick in the middle but very lightweight. The display is very bright which is great for reading outdoors. I turned OFF the Quick view setting, but when moving arm at night time if the tracker touches any blanket or sheet or moves too much it will light up. The screen constant lighting disturbed my sleep. Hopefully in the future Fitbit will offer some sort of "Do Not Disturb" mode for night time or the ability to disable the touchscreen.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: The worst Fitbit product
customer_reviews.text: I thought Fitbit finally released the best light weight fitness tracker, but I'm extremely disappointed. Things I like: 1) Lightweight 2) The fitness tracker is basic and does the job. Things I didn't like 1) Steps log, it's way off. there is no accuracy, for example, 400 steps would count it as 1xxx steps. especially while driving. extremely disappointed as my wife own Fitbit versa which is more accurate. 2) Display brightness is weak in the day time. If you do outdoor sports I don't advice you to buy it because it will be difficult to read. 3) Display on, it stays 2-3 sec only then it goes off. You cant adjust it in the setting. 4) Short charging cord
customer_reviews.author: Almannaee

customer_reviews.title: Great product with one design issue
customer_reviews.text: It has very nice features. I'm really happy about the data I get from the app. You have to wear it tight in order to get detailed sleep info. İ don't know what is with the band design. İt leaves a mark on my wrist. I believe it can be improved. Maybe a material that can breath so that it don't get sweaty underneath. Turning the vibration off should be an option. I couldn't find it in the settings. It will help save the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Hakan

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurately counts steps
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to other reviewers who said that this Fitbit does NOT count steps accurately! It counts steps when I sleep, eat, drive, etc. I'm returning it and buying the Alta that I loved using for 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: elainea

customer_reviews.title: 'Fat' is not a dirty word. I am fat. This gadget has helped me become less fat.
customer_reviews.text: I am morbidly obese. There, I said it. I do not ask anyone to accept my fat, embrace my fatness, or make fun of it. I am what I am. I love my body. I'll love it even more when I'm less obese. Therefore, I've bought this fitness tracker. Thus far, it has acquitted itself with aplomb. I have lost weight, I have been exercising more, and I feel healthier. I have been tracking my calorific intake also. So, yes, I'm fat, and I'm working on it. I am happy. This gadget helps.
customer_reviews.author: John Rabson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Too many features that are unnecessary with the Fitbit Inspire HR. The Fitbit Alta HR is my favorite. It’s small & does everything I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I have had my previous fitbit for 3 years. I purchased this Inspire HR and it literally worked for less than two weeks. The screen went dark, despite the fact it was charged, and never worked again. Customer service makes you jump through DIY troubleshooting hoops, is slow in their response, and it will take you multiple contacts with them to get a replacement. Very disappointed! Would not recommend. Will not purchase another fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Every "Gimme!" has a "Gotcha!"
customer_reviews.text: Great design, comfortable to wear, functional. Overall, decent product. My nitpicks are the build feels kind of cheap and you can't turn the brightness down. Biggest issue is the battery life: lasts about 2 days, nowhere near the claimed 5. Since this is marketed as the "affordable" Fitbit, you get what you pay for, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S

customer_reviews.title: Horrible - Avoid - Do Not Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have worn other Fitbit trackers, and thought I'd try this one because of it's sleek appearance. I tried this one, using it for different activities and there are several issues. First, the charging "dongle" is awful, magnet is weak - horrible idea. Even worse is how poorly it tracks your activities. My steps were never accurate regardless of activity. Lastly, it took a long time to sync and missed days. I can't believe they are selling this. AVOID this product - I tried to return but just missed the return window - which is frustrating. I plan to donate it as it just isn't worth dealing with.
customer_reviews.author: RGan

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly! I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for: 1. Not too big but a good product 2. Easy to use 3. Accurate 4. Other bands will make it really elegant for any occasion 5. It really motivates me to move more and that was what I was looking for The battery lasts 4 days, but that's what the product says. It charges really fast, so you can do it while taking a shower or doing dishes, not a biggie I did a lot of reading before buying this product and compare it with several others. For the people looking to keep track of their fitness and step up their games with exercise, this is the tracker to go!
customer_reviews.author: Jaminton

customer_reviews.title: Screen Glitched, Wont Come Back On
customer_reviews.text: Literally just unboxed this and the screen glitched out, now it wont come back on. The rare times that it does it just glitches out again. Did my research and apparently this happens often. Contacted support and was told to try restarting it or changing the clock face, none of which worked. They said somebody would get ahold of me through email following the live chat. still havent heard from them
customer_reviews.author: Rovin Escobar

customer_reviews.title: very simple to use
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is comparable to the Fitbit. It also reads texts and has a much nicer screen than the Fitbit because it is larger and in color. The app for this watch is called jyou pro and it is very simple to use. I love how the band stays where you put it, I notice it pops into the slots on the band to lock it in place so the band doesn’t pop out.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: Have had it less than 72 hours but I love it. Awesome sleep tracking, notifications are clear, and the lavender band is so cute-not like the plain black or manly ones of other trackers.
customer_reviews.author: detentionplz

customer_reviews.title: Faulty proven three times...
customer_reviews.text: This is, literally, my 3rd Inspire HR in less than 4 months (2019). The product keeps breaking/defective by the screen not responding after short use. I am able to confirm the watch is still active by holding the awake button it vibrates, attaching the charger it vibrates, and the app shows it as still active. However, the watch is not interactive when I tap the screen or hit the awake button. The experience is each brand new item purchase so not repaired. So, each are unique build and MAC from the others but each equally act the same in breaking within the month of purchase. Unless you like broken crap, don't purchase this junk...
customer_reviews.author: MoonyThinker

customer_reviews.title: I’m switching back to the Alta HR immediately
customer_reviews.text: I thought I’d like the resigned look better than the Alta HR and it’s nice but what you lose in functionality and battery 🔋 durability is a big disappointment. I can never get the battery to stay charged longer than 4 days! And that’s at reduced capability. I don’t have my phone calls come to it anymore. This tracker is always triggered and trying to select an exercise and I can’t turn the feature off so it’s constantly draining my battery! I miss my Alta HR!! It was so easy to use! I’m going back to that one!!
customer_reviews.author: CaliTristansmom

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs one of these
customer_reviews.text: I have always been sceptical about fitness trackers but decided to give one a try. I am amazed at how motivating it is. I love it. I haven’t used all the functions yet. I have used it for steps, alarms, activity tracking, calorie burn, sleep and heart rate. It gives very clear information both on the tracker and on the app. It was really easy to set up and is light and comfortable to wear. I got the pink one, which looks nice. I have my daily and weekly goals and I get feedback and messages on how I’m doing. I really love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: OK tracker, but the battery life is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I had some trouble when I first got it with accuracy in terms of active minutes (one day it gave me 250 active minutes!) but an update seems to fix that issue and now it seems to track close to what I do. I feel like if I am in the pool doing water aerobics it does not count as many minutes as it should. I really got it to track my heart rate, and it seems to be accurate there. The real problem is the battery life. There is no way this lasts 5 days on a charge. I charged it yesterday afternoon and it is below 50% today.
customer_reviews.author: Kimba_g

customer_reviews.title: Can’t see display in direct sunlight
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t able to test this out to much before I had to return the item . The look is sleek and color is wonderful, however in direct sunlight you are not able to read the display. The purpose of this purchase was to monitor my heart rate while hiking outdoors so not being able to view the display was a no brainer it wasn’t the right fitness tracker for me .
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Mom 38

customer_reviews.title: Not for sleep
customer_reviews.text: So it’s pretty good, except what makes it impossible to use is the incredibly bright screen that goes off at the smallest bump at night. Blinds me and wakes me up. Makes it useless for sleep tracking.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bonaventure

customer_reviews.title: HR not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The HR tracker is never accurate- always reading lower by at least 20 beats per minute. When exercising it will say my HR is around 120 but when I take my pulse it is actually 180's, which is a major difference. The sleep tracker is also off every night. I don't expect this to be perfect but it is not even close. I also find it extremely uncomfortable-it sticks too far off the wrist so is constantly being caught on clothing and I have to be really careful not to knock it on things. I regret buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Love my  new Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: My old Fitbit expired, so purchased this one after evaluating all of the reviews on wearable devices. The high marks are well-deserved. This device works well for what it's designed! Does a great job of tracking steps and sleep, and the app gives very good feedback. Additionally, the workout tracker is super helpful. You can set it to record running, weightlifting, biking, swimming, interval training, and treadmill. You can turn it on to one of these settings to record your workout, and then still record it as another style of workout (like Piyo or Plyo, etc.). Very good.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great for health and fitness!
customer_reviews.text: Synced with my fitness pal and my weight loss journey is unstoppable.
customer_reviews.author: Fabricio

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money! This Fitbit is AWFUL and very inaccurate. I got it Saturday night and Sunday morning I activated and synced it to the app. I hadn’t even worn it yet and it showed I had already burned 500 calories. I thought that was super weird. Nonetheless I decided to try it out on my Sunday morning hike. My watch said the hike was over 3 miles which was incorrect. The hike is only 2 miles. I got home and was sitting on the couch looked down at the watch and it had added an extra 300 steps!
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Will not stay connected on Bluetooth. You can have the phone within one inch of the device and will not connect. I manage some 14,000 computers and so this is not rocket science to me.Takes about 90 minutes to setup the first time as you have to do a very slow firmware upgrade. If you want a watch that gives you steps on heart beats then it is fine as you can look at the face of the device, but that is not what they were selling. Go elsewhere for a better device.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B.

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this watch
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with this watch. Before this watch I've had the FitBit Charge & then the Alta. My biggest issue with the Alta is that I couldn't see the screen walking outside in the sunlight. Inspire HR you don't have the problem! I love that this watch is compatible with 3rd party apps like Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, & Google Calendar. So useful for me! I love the graphics and the fact that you have a timer and a stopwatch. Also, the fact that you can activate whatever exercise you are doing in HUGE! The different watch faces are cute as well. Well done, FitBit!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Caridad

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Small, simple, but packed with lots of cool things. Heart rate sensor, sleep tracker, etc.. I like it. It comes with a magnetic charger. The battery life is really good. Software is easy to use and navigate. The only thing I didnt like was the silicone band. It irritates my wrist, so I decided to purchase a leather one on their website. Much better. Overall a good piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Miramontes Jr

customer_reviews.title: iPhone Problems without a fix in sight
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for a few hours then I stopped getting message notifications. I looked all over the internet to figure what settings I had wrong. Finally I called fitbit and they said “We’re aware of this problem” I asked for the fix and they said “We’re working on it” So, no fix in sight. Message notifications was a big reason I picked this one. Be aware if you have an iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Fan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Fitbit as a present to myself. Specifically because the product is advertised as tracking all kinds of exercise, including weight lifting. Imagine my surprise when it did no such thing. Yes, somewhere on the web there is an answer to how to do I TV, but no direction exist with the item and even step tracking has a steep learning curve. I a EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED with this item. Also, one month to the day after I began to wear the Fitbit it stopped displaying anything but heart rate and the time, thus becoming essentially an expensive, ugly watch. Wow.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Syrovy

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this version and decided to pay a little extra for the bpm option (heart rate tracking). I love this product. It stays on with no trouble, i can wear during any activity and in the shower or pool with no issue. the display is very easy to read (for olderish eyes - lol). It was not trouble at all syncing to my phone and the app. Great product - i've recommended to 2 others so far that love theirs also. You won't be disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HTX

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate monitor doesn’t work accurately!
customer_reviews.text: Great size easy to use and set up. But unfortunately mine didn’t work accurately!! I was looking for a sleek activity tracker that offers the time, counts steps, delivers texts or phone updates, but most importantly has a heart rate monitor. I thought I was lucky to find this one for the price. Especially with the sleep tracker , which I thought was cool. But I’ve had the watch a week now and it hasn’t monitored my heart once! The green light in the back lights up as if it’s doing something. And I feel like it must be doing something if it can track my sleep, but the heart icon stays inactive.
customer_reviews.author: Tashauna Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: I avoided fitbits like the plague for years. When my dr said my health needed to improve I had to reach foe one. This has helped me stay connected with a semi accurate step count. I work with my hands a lot and am fairly sedative in my activity. This has informed me I reached my step goal a couple days a week without really doing majority of the steps. Still working on the sleep measurements. It has only taken 3 months of use to feel my sleep scofe matched how I felt I slept. But, overall it does what I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn L

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate monitor frequently fails
customer_reviews.text: Two days after I received it, the heart rate monitor stopped working and therefore I only get basic sleep tracking rather than the detailed information. I have spent way too much time troubleshooting. They won't take it back until their system shows I have successfully completed all the required troubleshooting steps. The steps are not clear. I would not recommending purchasing this device
customer_reviews.author: JSB

customer_reviews.title: Short life
customer_reviews.text: This is my third attempt at getting a Fitbit that actually works for more than a week. This one failed as well. As others have said, first week was impressive...it did everything it said it would do. For unknown reasons, it suddenly unpaired from my Android phone & will not sync. I've tried several recommended steps to get it going again but nothing is working. If this function fails a week in, I can only imagine what else can go wrong with continued use. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: louisville

customer_reviews.title: Love it but....
customer_reviews.text: Love my Fitbit Inspire HR because of its continuous heart rate measurement. Am able to offload the data as graphs to my IOS devices and my PC. Send an annotated graph to my doctor. However, one nice feature, the lighting up of the display when you raise and rotate your wrist to read it quit working after 2 weeks. I now need to press the side button to activate the display. This makes me wonder what else may stop working in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A Wadsworth

customer_reviews.title: A great fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a fitness tracker that worked with a specific diet I was trying, and while the diet didn't last, the Fitbit did! I really like the Fitbit app, and the Fitbit itself is incredibly comfortable. I also really like the pale lavender color. It's neutral enough to go with anything but just different enough to stand out when I want it to. Also, I've had a Fitbit in the past and have had really good experiences with customer service. Unfortunately, I lent my old one to a friend who was training for a marathon and, well, let's just say I'm happy with this one, as it's smaller and works well for me. :)
customer_reviews.author: DianeTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the Charge HR and the only reason I upgraded was for the waterproof functionality. I do a lot of swimming and wanted to track that activity as well. I do like that function but feel I had to give up a lot in the trade. If I use the motion activation feature the battery depletes very fast. When swiping to go through the app it shuts down after about the 3rd swipe and I have to start over with swiping. It gets very frustrating. Also it is confusing when you use the function to track a certain exercise. Not really "on the go " friendly.
customer_reviews.author: colleen mcnally

customer_reviews.title: Find something better
customer_reviews.text: It works well enough for the first few months, but now the battery drains rapidly and won't hold a charge. A quick search of the Fitbit community help site reveals this is an all too common problem, with tons of people suffering the same issue, and Fitbit responding with nonsense about turning off notifications or just sending you a new one if it's within the year warranty period. Environmentally irresponsible and absolute crap that their product is so unreliable, yet obviously cheaply made that they can just hand them out like candy as they fail.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Gates

customer_reviews.title: Have had to replace twice
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Inspire HR for 11 months and just had to call for a second replacement. The Fitbit customer service representatives I spoke to on both occasions were rude and sounded very annoyed. When this device is working it’s not bad, it does what it’s supposed to most of the time, however the function that lets you see the screen when you raise you wrist rarely works. I do not recommend buying this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Haney

customer_reviews.title: Flawed design
customer_reviews.text: I truly like the watch, however, after 90 days of constant use I caught my band on a ledge and pulled the band off the watch. I am unable to repair as the pin did not break, but the connection point at edge of the watch did. A tiny flaw, but huge when you consider I spend $100 on it and I am unable to return due to the 90 day return policy with Amazon. I have attempted to repair myself with superglue, but of course it does not fix permanently. Please advise as to how to replace or repair.
customer_reviews.author: Gear Guy

customer_reviews.title: Small in size but makes a big impact
customer_reviews.text: If you don't need all the bells and whistles of a more expensive model- the inspire breaks it down so simple that it's hard not to have results. I love the ability to switch out the bands- it's super easy. Also fitbit has customer service- that actually exists. I called them about a question and got through right away. So impressive. I have graduated up and this is my 3rd model in 10 years. They continually make their products better yet simple to use. I purchased my fitbit 3 month ago and am 10 lbs down. Syncs with my fitness pal- the 2 apps communicate. It can't be any easier you are set up for success. Thank you Fitbit!
customer_reviews.author: Ted Florynski

customer_reviews.title: It is almost like an iWatch without the price tag and short battery life
customer_reviews.text: I had the original Fitbit One but I kept losing it so I switched to iWatch. I got tired of charging my iWatch so I decided to give Fitbit Inspire a try. I was pleasantly surprised that it not only track steps and heart rate but it also can be connect to tell me when I have a call coming in, show me texts, and calendar events. I also like that it is lighter than the iWatch and it has a much more in depth dashboard that shows more details by hour than iWatch’s health dashboard.
customer_reviews.author: K L

customer_reviews.title: Love the Lilac Color and Long-Lasting Charge
customer_reviews.text: Love: The color of the lavender band A band that comes in two sizes A band that doesn't catch onto clothing A charger that is so ez-pz to affix A charge that lasts longer than a day or two Text messages that stay until you read them Edit to add: It's OK if you forget to take it off before getting in the shower! Don't Love: It doesn't count flights of stairs Apparent inaccuracy of steps completed each day A text font that is SO small and can't be adjusted No "military time" selection A charging cord that is all of about 3" long (seriously?!)
customer_reviews.author: Regular Gal

customer_reviews.title: Android app remains glitchy
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed the Fitbit and encouragement/accountability for steps. The app and blue tooth connection is spotty with the Android and mine has the hardest time when I transition from my car Bluetooth. The clasp is now better then the magnetic one. My only issue remains that it is not super hardy. This is the third purchase in about two years. First one, clasp broke. Lost. Second one. Clasp broke. Lost. Third one corrupted, numbers for time went from 8:40 to *:*0. However all that said it provides me the incentives and accountability I require. Just wish they lasted longer. This past one made it just over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Medrivecar

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this do I could count steps and compete with friends along with monitor my sleep. I was never able to invite friends. After hours of dealing with Fitbit it only got worse. Then it wouldn't monitor my heart rate therefore wouldn't monitor my sleep. So the three main reasons I bought the thing don't work. After days of dealing with Fitbit nothing was resolved and was only told that they are working on it. I can't return it because I don't have the box it came in nor the time to take it to a UPS drop off. So now I own a 105 dollar watch that does was a free app on my phone can do.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: HR can be inaccurate, but otherwise, really good!
customer_reviews.text: Heart rate monitor gets confused at times when resting, will show a high heart rate, but otherwise it's been very helpful to get me started on exercise. I enjoy the sleep feature because it helps make more sense of my sleep patterns, and I love how it reminds me to get off my butt at work. Women-the period tracker is AMAZING and I think that is the 2nd favorite thing about this product for me.
customer_reviews.author: Meagen Hoy

customer_reviews.title: Great fit bit for the basics!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom, who I have to admit is definitely not tech savvy when it comes to these types of devices. However, once we set it up for her she absolutely loves it! Bought it in white because it was cheaper than all the other colors but the band can be changed to whatever you want... Great Gift idea for those who just want to monitor a few health points such as sleep, heart rate, stepa etc.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina L Carde

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS! First, I should have known better than to buy it off Amazon as you cannot return it, even with prime. Second, I have had it for a month and I have spent more time trying to get it to work right than I ever did with the Alta. It goes into weirdo modes where it shuts down and has to be set, just set, on the charger for 5 sec. Upon doing so, it unsyncs from the app and then vibrates constantly telling you it's not connected. I have taken it off twice in the middle of the night due to the incessant vibrating from lack of connections. Do not buy this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Billie jo schall

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: My doc recommended that I get a fitness tracker with heart rate capabilities to monitor my pulse throughout the day and night, as well as during activity/exercise and rest. So far, from what I can tell, the accuracy is on point. I love all the different features and that I can track not only runs and walks, but also swimming, biking and weights. The relax feature ensures that I take a few minutes each day to unwind... I particularly like using this when I feel stressed and right before bed. This item is super comfortable and doesn't irritate my wrist while I sleep or when I'm running. It's also comfortable in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Adams

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, poor support, poor sync
customer_reviews.text: This device works fairly well but it is more trouble to sync than it is worth. I just spent an hour trying to make it sync with my computer. I tried all sorts of things including restarting both the fitbit and my computer 3 times. Review Update: I have had this for about 6 months and Fitbit has still not corrected the obvious software problem. Syncing is very difficult, I usually waste 15 minutes or more trying to make the piece of crap sync. The product is way, way overpriced for the overall poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: CurtE - Green Bay

customer_reviews.title: Battery suddenly not charging
customer_reviews.text: It's fascinating that suddenly the device is malfunctioning right as I am outside of the return window. I've been using this for a little over a month and now am having issues charging it. It is stuck at 3% and then jumps to 12. Contacting fitbit support and will keep this updated. Other than that it was nice while it lasted. Was able to monitor my heart rate and I like that I can read text messages (handy for remaining polite when talking with customers and coworkers while still feeling "plugged in"). I don't wear this to sleep, though... it is too uncomfortable. I dont use the app as much as I thought I would. Good heart rate monitor though.
customer_reviews.author: Burke

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE MY FITBIT! I love how it can track my sleep through the app and I can keep track of my water intake and the app tells me how many more oz to go. It’s fun to see your numbers and definitely makes you want to do more steps, drink more water and get better sleep.
customer_reviews.author: KiddoK93

customer_reviews.title: Easy to wear and use
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift about 7 months ago. I wear it all the time. It seems to work well for tracking steps. I question the calorie tracking. I like it for sleep tracking also. It is comfortable and easy to wear. My biggest complaint is that it occasionally gets stuck. Meaning, it will stick on time mode and you can't see anything else. This has happened probably 4-5 times since I have had it. The fix is to go into the mobile app and change the clock face. This seems to reset it. That part is a little annoying but a decent product overall. I would still recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SoTXBear

customer_reviews.title: Sporadically malfunctions
customer_reviews.text: Broken but still usable; for the price I expected more reliability. Firstly, I like the features which include a fairly accurate sleep feature, pulse monitor, and step counter. I like that it automatically logs my exercise. The app is quite user friendly. The problem? Unfortunately it sporadically decides not to show any display on the watch itself. Dark screen as if dead. Nothing fixes it besides waiting for it to die entirely and recharge it, and then *sometimes* it returns to normal functioning. Very frustrating as its seen no abuse and doesn't even get wet.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: broke after owning for six weeks
customer_reviews.text: OK I know its probably under warranty since I've only had it since late February, but really I don't care for it anyway. The basic thing I use it for is logging my steps or other exercise and the clock. While the other aspects are interesting, they are not crucial. What really angers me is that the watch is plastic and a part that holds the wrist strap in broke off the watch. Wrist strap worked fine. I'm going to go with something not made of plastic if I can find it, preferably not made in China. Didn't have it long enough to rate its features.
customer_reviews.author: Jillie0808

customer_reviews.title: Defective after 3 month of use and the seller, Adorama Camera, wouldn't honor an authorized refund
customer_reviews.text: This item started acting up after 3 months of use. The display on the screen was blank, even though it seemed to be tracking my stats on the app. By 6 months, most of the features on the Fitbit wouldn't work. Could not scan through the menus on the Fitbit to see my progress. Again, the app still seemed to be tracking it. Amazon authorized a refund, but the seller (Adorama Camera) wouldn't honor the refund. Amazon finally came through for me and issued me a refund. However, I will never do business with Adorama Camera again.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra K Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Wife didn't like this & returned it.
customer_reviews.text: She has a small wrist, but this FitBit was way too thick, bulky & large for her. It was uncomfortable for her when the strap was tight enough to keep it properly in place. It dramatically over-counted her "steps"because it was counting her arm swings. The day she decided to return it, she woke up to find it had logged her with 65 steps, and she hadn't even gotten out of bed yet! Apparently it was counting her arm movements during the night.
customer_reviews.author: HTDMike

customer_reviews.title: Screen shows ALL activities
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today to replace my scratched Alta HR. I hate it. When you scroll through the watch to see steps, heartrate, and distance, you also see water oz, running, biking, sleep, and weight. There is no way to get rid of extra options. I have read multiple Fitbit forums and many have complained of this, but Fitbit doesn't have a solution. I don't want others to see my weight and those exercise options aren't needed. It's going back and I am getting a discontinued Alta. $50 more, but I don't have to see things I don't want to.
customer_reviews.author: Fran B

customer_reviews.title: Not as accurate as my alta for sleep
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Received in May 2019. It's now a glorified watch. The screen no longer let's me check stats; just shows the time. My Alta worked fine for over 3 years, Inspire 3 months! Dont know if I got a bad one or the inspire is just not made to last! My alta finally died and I chose this for its replacement. Sleep tracking doesnt seem as accurate but, I wanted the heartrate feature. The battery seems to need charging more often.
customer_reviews.author: GEM

customer_reviews.title: Why have a swim mode when water just stops it from working.
customer_reviews.text: Already quit working after 1 month. Claims to have a swim mode to count your exercise while swimming. First time in the water and it will not turn on anymore. This is the 2nd fitbit to do this. Time to move onto something else. Quit claiming water resistance and putting swim tracking. I would like my money back
customer_reviews.author: Erhan

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear Invictus or Citizen. Getting use to a fitbit took some doing. But it's motivating on my wrist. I'm fat. 5'6 270 pounds. This simple, yet sophisticated device has helped me greatly. I don't need to starve myself as I know how I'm doing at all times. With its help I've dropped 20 pounds by simply go for an extra walk and not eating that second course. I am grateful for it on my wrist, no matter how annoying it is.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Returning This CHEAP product
customer_reviews.text: Oh was I disappointed! I have an Alta HR and the battery is really acting up so I purchased this Inspire II as a replacement. The charger for Inspire II is NOTHING like the Alta HR and is a super challenge to get it to stay on the tracker long enough to charge it. The Alta HR can accept replacement bands (metal, mesh) and they just pop on and off. With the inspire you have to take pins out and replace the band and then the pins. Very cumbersome. Yes, the Inspire II is about half the cost, but it's not worth $80!
customer_reviews.author: P.J.

customer_reviews.title: Basic model
customer_reviews.text: Good starter watch. I’m an aerialist, I do stairmaster, and power yoga, and frankly I don’t think it tracks any of my activities properly. I think if you do garden variety sports it must be great, but for the “obscure arts” this watch doesn’t get me... my bf has a more expensive one and it tells him how many floors he’s climbed while I’ll do 45 minutes of stairs and it tells me I was “walking”. Umm, no. Overall, I like the features and it’s really motivating me to move more. I also love to see just how much I move at work, etc. I’ll definitely buy a better one at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Elin

customer_reviews.title: Setting this thing up is a nightmare ....
customer_reviews.text: This is so ridiculous. I've had it for 5 hours and still have not been able to set up. I've started and re-started my computer, bluetooth, etc. There is no manual ... you find it online and then it doesn't address the simple issue of getting it synced up and what to do if it doesn't. What they tell you to do, doesn't work. I'm so frustrated. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Major Disappointment Over Alta HR
customer_reviews.text: Its water resistant- that’s the one major benefit over the Alta hour. Beyond the screen is slightLy larger but not a game changer. They change the band format so you’re forced to buy new bands. The most annoying part is the charger. They keep costs down (or profits up) by not including a charger itself, just a cable. Like the bands, whole new format compared to the Alta so you can’t use your old charger. But the real issue, the cable is so short its virtually useless It is like 5” and magnetic so I end up putting the Fitbit on a box to raise it near my laptop or USB charger or an outlet.
customer_reviews.author: B. Colonna

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little watch!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I really just wanted a non-intrusive watch, but I love the bells and whistles! It’s lovely most of the time. The battery life is fantastic- about a week or more. A few cons: It fails to sync from time to time, prompting me to re-teach the app about my watch. It’s step count is a little generous. Detailed sleep tracking is locked behind a paywall.
customer_reviews.author: Henry D

customer_reviews.title: Skip this product
customer_reviews.text: I had a cheap version of a fit bit which worked very well but the battery was terrible and needed to be charged once a day, so I brought this product. Boy was that a mistake! It took me 90 minutes to get the app on my phone (took me 10 with my old watch). Using the app and the watch was mind boggling! It did everything except fly, which is my mind means it does NOTHING well. No accurate on Blood pressure, heart rate, sleep, etc. That is assuming you can navigate through the watch and the app to see what the results are. Returning this product and going for one that does less -- and does it better!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: works well but short battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing this for a few months now. It is comfortable and relatively small and unobtrusive. It is difficult to do much on the device itself but, luckily, you can do practically everything on the phone app. My only criticism is that I have to charge it every 4 days or so and I often forget to put it back on.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long; Feb - April 2020
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit worked great and now it’s not working. It’s not charging. Display shows 1% and a bulb with a slash, the touch screen does not work and I’ve tried to reset it but nothing works. I’m so disappointed because I really do like this product and I was hoping it would last me at the very least one year. I purchase in Feb. received on time Feb19,2020 and it stopped work April 29,2020. All I keep getting from support is to reset but that doesn’t work. By the way I never used it in water I purchased the inspire Hr.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using it for a week now and I love it. The battery did last 5 days for me and sleep tracking works great. I’ve been showering with it and no problems. If you want to track your exercise, you have to be connected to gps on phone. I have not noticed a decrease in battery because of this, so I think it’s fine, especially for the price. Some ppl in the reviews are crazy, If you want the features of a $500 tracker then go buy a $500 tracker. For $99, this one works great!
customer_reviews.author: Yitsy S.

customer_reviews.title: Might be OK.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to better track my fitness and to help manage that. So far it tracks step just fine and calories burned too. I do get notifications of on it which is welcomed. However, it comes with a small and large band. I've got large hands and wrists, there are no XL bands available for it, and there should be. Also, sleep tracking tells me that I'm only getting one or two of sleep even after knowing I got 7-8 hours. I'll continue to evaluate it before my time runs out to return it. We'll see, more to come before i can recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack T

customer_reviews.title: The perfect fitness tracker/watch when you don’t want a smart watch
customer_reviews.text: Of all the fitness trackers out there, Fitbit is still the truest one. It is able to track all your health stats, in many cases without you even telling it to do so. Quite accurate in most regards but it still struggles to achieve my precise step count. I’ve even tried adjusting my stride length in settings and it doesn’t quite have it right. Still, overall rather accurate and the best tracker I’ve used. A caution, while you can get notifications, it does not have a large screen. If you are looking more for a smart watch function, this is not the right Fitbit model, there are others that would be better for that.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: This product is crap! I should have known better as I had a FitBit in the past. The previous generation had issues with the charger, but I was hopeful this one would be better. It wasn’t. It failed to sync to the app, would run out of power so frequently that I had to charge it overnight so forget the sleep tracking. Finally it stopped charging altogether-just 6 months after purchase. I did not wear this in the shower or even to do dishes despite the claim that it was water resistant. Just a piece of junk. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Latta Russell

customer_reviews.title: Overcounts steps; works for heart rate
customer_reviews.text: Step counts for moderate to fast walks are not accurate because it counts the arm movement as a step too. All the remedies suggested by customer support are useless and waste of time. Sleep tracking seemed to be good the first week of use, but second week, it is off. If I am reading in bed, it thinks I am sleep. Other times, I am asleep, it shows as awake. The heart rate monitor does work well; I verified manually. I use it mainly for HR; I use Google FIT on my phone for step counts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!  Love the slim design, the easy-to-read display, and the fact that it’s waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: I like the slim design of my Fitbit Inspire HR much better than my old Fitbit Charge HR, which I found to be rather bulky for my taste. Setup of the Inspire HR was very easy following the instructions provided by the Fitbit App. I was very happy to see while shopping for my new Fitbit that it’s waterproof, unlike my old one; that’s an upgrade that helps a lot! Can’t rate all the features yet since I just set up my Fitbit Inspire HR and still have to learn how to use the features, but from what I’ve seen so far I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NyteOwl

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: 6 month update- still love this style of tracker, I do not use the band it came with. I bought a flexible fabric band for about 10 dollars so i can wear it on my ankle.. the inspire is still working well,, still holds a long lasting charge.. Great product everything i said before i still agree with 6 months later.. Love this style, giada flex, then upgraded to the alta, did not like the alta so went back to a flex but recently fitbit wouldn't sync with the flex, too out dated. Researched and tried inspire, love it, simple light weight like the flex, very happy with my choice this time.
customer_reviews.author: H. Goslow

customer_reviews.title: A lot more bells a whistles than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This fitbit has impressed me. I really like that it tracks my sleep because it's just fun to look at the patters. It also gives me the option to track food and water intake, tracks heart rate and more. It's super easy to track exercises with just a few swipes on the tracker, so no need to mess with my phone. It also reminds me every hour to move. You can also customize the front display, which is a little thing that I have fun playing with quite often. Very versatile for the price. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy from Amazon if you want warranty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fitbit Feb. 14,2020 and it stopped working July 8,2020 .I had bought it from Amazon and when I went to file a warranty claim it said it does not recognize Amazon order number . Don't buy form Amazon if you want your warranty !!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: kathleen mahon

customer_reviews.title: Loved it, but........
customer_reviews.text: I loved it but was astounded to learn you cannot change the display time from 3 seconds!!!!! You can tap it to get a couple more seconds but I would argue that if you are running and trying to read the face by tapping it to keep it on, you may well fall down. They apparently currently have no plans to update this to an extended display time . This was a dealbreaker for me so I'm sending it back
customer_reviews.author: Sunshinetgo

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace my Fitbit Alta when it stopped working and I LOVE the Inspire HR. The band is much more comfortable than the Alta bands were and much more secure. The heart rate is accurate (compared to a pulse oximeter and a blood pressure cuff that bother offer heart rate/pulse). The sleep stages seem to be accurate and are interesting to review. Also love that this one can go in the pool with me to help me track my water aerobics! I was afraid the light lavender color band would look dirty/dingy quickly - but it looks great even after months of daily wear. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced,  but worth it. Update: Glitchy after 3 months!
customer_reviews.text: Update: save your money! Just go buy an off brand watch, this thing looks pretty but already the screen blacks out and it doesn't put out a bluetooth signal. No bluetooth signal means you cannot connect to the Fitbit app to track your steps, calories, HR, etc. Its basically a pretty piece of plastic instead of the tool it was designed to be. I contacted Fitbit support and they will not refund or replace the watch even though its defective. I only wear this at work for fashion mostly, so I cannot believe it broke so fast! No scratches or anything! Complete RIP OFF! 1 month later, its still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: Ny

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Waterproof Features
customer_reviews.text: I loved the slim fit of my Fitbit Alta and like how easy it was to change the band so when it stopped working I was super bummed. I bought this Inspire HR as a replacement so I could wear in the pool and track swimming. I love the swim feature but I hate the band. It’s a major pain to change the band, as the pin design is difficult to use, and the pins can easily get lost. The Alta band was so easy to use and more attractive. Overall, it’s a decent tracker but I wish the Alta came in a swimproof model.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Lance

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL CHOICE OF CLOCK FACES.
customer_reviews.text: Most of the faces are stacked hours over minutes that don't read as time. If you want 12:30 it only comes with a kitty, racoon or ant drawing, I am an adult. The other choice is 12:30 with four more stats on the face so you need reading glasses to see the time. I loved my Charge 2 that has a clock face with 12:30, date & steps. That makes sense to me. I am VERY disappointed and thinking of returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Busby

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is not up to par
customer_reviews.text: THis says it up to 7 days. I am only getting 3 to maybe 4 days. Not sure why. The app is not keeping up with the days. It remains on usually 1 of 7 for two days before it will kick into the next day. My old alta that just quite after 3yrs battery lasted longer. Will be calling them to see what they can do. Maybe I received a defective one, who knows.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Geracitano

customer_reviews.title: So far works well
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Fitbit for a couple of months. So far no real problems. Seems to track sleep pretty good. I used it a lot for swimming. The issues are when swimming. It seems water resistance enough. Somtimes, the exercise stops on its own so I can't rely on it to track 100% in the pool. I have only noticed this with swimming. The other issues is that when it starts tracking swimming, it's really hard to get it to restart the session with wet or damp hands. Cycling classes are recorded inaccurately in terms of calories, but most trackers can't really know know many calories you are burning.
customer_reviews.author: H. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this model fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace twice. The bluetooth stops working so you can't sync to phone app. Read on the internet that this Fitbit model is notorious for this issue. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: mosckb2

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for! And a great price!
customer_reviews.text: 3 months in and my very favorite fitbit. Great size for the wrist for when doing yoga. Comfortable bending of the wrist compared to the larger blaze I had. Great touch screen and HR monitor. HR monitor may be slightly off but good enough and my only other issue has been that one time I got a way more active minutes than I thought I did but I cannot confirm this. Accurate step tracking for the most part. Light colored band keeps its color and is easy to rinse off. All around exactly what I was looking for with tech, size, and as a fitness tracker!
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: Plastic is weak, broke after 13 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed. I have loved and used this tracker everyday, but after only 13 months the plastic backing has broken and I can no longer wear it. I didn't even know it was happening because I don't take the watch off — it just fell off 2 days ago for no clear reason until I inspected more closely. After 1 hour 20 min on the phone waiting for customer service, they told me that there is nothing to be done to repair or replace it, but I could get a 25% discount on another one. Certainly won't be buying from Fitbit again — very frustrated because the functionality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Lost my  continued support
customer_reviews.text: This versa hr does not record sleep accurately. You are invited to buy an upgrade app. I would like to just set a 10 minute timer now and again to track my exercise. If there is a way, it is buried inside the manual. This is the second HR I tried because I like to swim. The first one did nothing and I sent it back. The company has zero customer service and I never got my replacement after returning it. Hours of trying to get a human to interact was wasted.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Helps me to move more throughout the day
customer_reviews.text: This is my first watch style fitness tracker. I like it better than any of the others I have tried particularly for this reason. The sleep info is interesting, but not enough that I like wearing it while sleeping so I'm not really using that function any longer. The steps appear to be accurate, I've watched and they increase by step as I'm walking. I also like the reminder to move at 10 min to the hour, it makes me get up from my desk chair hourly and get some steps in throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie

customer_reviews.title: I must walk wrong
customer_reviews.text: I returned the product and a replacement because it didn't count my steps accurately. I tried a lot of things, like just checking when I was doing my street walking, but I would consistently count to 100 and it wouldn't have counted that many steps. It was even worse when I was walking inside or doing gardening. I gather that swinging the arms helps but you cant do that with a shovel, or a wheelbarrow. Or even with groceries, but those are steps, too! It made me question the accuracy of the other measurements and while I have no way to check them, I just decided to return the product and not worry about it any more.
customer_reviews.author: hstrybuff

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit's worst watch. Screen issues.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: comfortable. Narrow band causes less swet. Great app. Superb sleep tracking with rem, non rem, and light sleep tracking. Cons: the screen periodically locks up reqiring a reset of the watch. The mode that causes the screen to turn on when ypu lift your wrist does not work. You have to thrust your wrist just right and then the screen stays on gor only half a second, which usually isnt long enough to read the time. This means that checking the time is a two handed operation because you have to push the button. Overall, this model is the bottom of the barrel compared to normal fitbit quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Fitbit Inspire HR Heart Rate and Fitness Tracker, One Size (S and L Bands Included), 1 Count
product_meta.description: Color:Black (Heart Rate)Fitbit inspire HR is a friendly heart rate and fitness tracker for every day that helps you build healthy habits. This encouraging companion motivates you to reach your weight and fitness goals and even enjoy the journey with 24/7 heart rate, workout features, calorie burn tracking, goal celebrations, sleep stages and up to 5 days of battery life. Large fits wrist 7.1" to " 8.7"" in circumference. Small fits wrist 5.5" to " 7.1"". Syncs with iPhone 4s and later, iPad 3 gen and later, Android 5.0 and later and windows 10 device.
feature_bullets: Utilize 24/7 heart rate to accurately track calorie burn, resting heart rate & heart rate zones during workouts

Track all day activity, including steps, distance, hourly activity, active minutes and calories burned. The Fitbit inspire band is made of a flexible, durable elastomer material similar to that used in many sport watches, and fastens with a peg and loop
Automatically track sleep plus due to the heart rate feature and get more insights into your light & deep sleep stages
Enjoy up to 5 days of battery for daily progress without constant charging. Varies with use and other factors. Charge time (0 100 percent): 2 hours

Automatically and conveniently record workouts like walks, swimming & bike rides in a snap with smart track. Stores heart rate data at 1 second intervals during exercise tracking and at 5 second intervals all other times

Radio transceiver: Bluetooth 4.0. Fitbit inspire and inspire HR. are water resistant to 50 meters. We do not recommend wearing inspire or inspire hr. in a hot tub or sauna. Operating temperature: 14 degree to 113 degree Fahrenheit. Maximum operating altitude: 28,000 feet
